page.title: 04Changing Crockenhill part 2
page.content: from many ailments Today, many of the old houses have either been knocked down and new houses built on the site or their roles have been changed (eg Highcroft Hall on page 17). This infilling has increased the population and density of the village. Socially the village has changed and the standard of living is much higher. The workers cottages are now sought after properties and the owners like the majority of the people who live in the village work either in London or nearby towns. The farms employ only 1 or 2 workers and have changed from fruit and vegetable growing to extensive cereal production and most of the tasks are carried out by machines (see pages 10 and 11 on working farms). Although Crockenhill has changed it still retains much of its village atmosphere.
